page.title: 17TRANSPORT NEAR WALLINGFORD
page.content: {Transport}in this area consists of roads and the river.Ancient routes in the area are the Ridge Way paths and the{Icknield Way}.The river is used for pleasure boating.The main Oxford to Henley,A423T road passes along the north of this area.The{Icknield Way}was only 2.5 metres wide and much of it is not used today.A survey on the{A4074} which links Wallingford and Goring indicated a busy road.The road was 7.5 metres wide with grassy edges.On a week day an average of 100 cars and 55 lorries pass in 30 minutes.As the area is mainly large farms most of the roads are narrow country lanes often single track.There is a grass air strip near the Thames opposite Carmel College.
